intro: Nesothamnus, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of silver-gray leaves and bright yellow composite flowers. They are native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. Nesothamnus species are generally drought-tolerant and adapted to arid environments. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and blooms.
